original: yang na phyag bya ba dang / mchod pa dang / sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bskul ba dang / sems can gyi don mdzod cig ces bzhugs par gsol ba dang /
analyzed: yang na phyag bya ba dang / mchod pa dang / sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bskul ba dang / sems can gyi don mdzod cig ces bzhugs par gsol ba dang /
translated: Or else, the homage, the offerings, the confession of sins, the rejoicing in merit, the request to turn the wheel of the Dharma, the request to remain in the world,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bla na med pa'i byang chub chen por yongs @184b su bsngo ba'i byang chub kyi spyod pa de lta bu nyid bzang po ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bla na med pa'i byang chub chen por yongs @184b su bsngo ba'i byang chub kyi spyod pa de lta bu nyid bzang po ste /

analyzed: smon par bya ba yin pa dang / mjug nas phan yon 'byung ba dang / 'bras bu bzang po de lta bu 'dod cing smon par bya ba yin pas smon lam mo //
translated: It is a prayer because it is the object of aspiration, because benefits arise from the conclusion, and because it is the object of aspiration for such a good result.

original: de ltar smon lam 'di ming don dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar smon lam 'di ming don dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, this prayer is consistent with its name.

original: 'phags pa bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam la don bcus ston te /
analyzed: 'phags pa bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam la don bcus ston te /
translated: The noble Good Conduct Prayer is taught through ten topics:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la phyag bya ba dang / de la mchod pa bya ba dang / nyes pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / mya ngan las mi 'da' bar bzhugs su gsol ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la phyag bya ba dang / de la mchod pa bya ba dang / nyes pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / mya ngan las mi 'da' bar bzhugs su gsol ba dang /
translated: paying homage to the Tathagata, making offerings to him, confessing faults, rejoicing in merit, turning the wheel of Dharma, requesting the Buddhas not to pass into nirvana,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba dang / smon lam gyi rab tu dbye ba dang / smon lam gyi mtha' dang / smon lam gyi phan yon no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba dang / smon lam gyi rab tu dbye ba dang / smon lam gyi mtha' dang / smon lam gyi phan yon no //

original: spyir ni sangs rgyas su grub pa man chad ngan song gsum du skyes pa yan chad gnas mthon dman gang du skye ba'i dbang ni bdag la yod do //
analyzed: spyir ni sangs rgyas su grub pa man chad ngan song gsum du skyes pa yan chad gnas mthon dman gang du skye ba'i dbang ni bdag la yod do //

original: de yang rang gi sems bcos legs ma legs las 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang rang gi sems bcos legs ma legs las 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, this depends on whether my mind is well or badly controlled.

original: sems bcos legs nas dge ba la zhugs na ni sangs rgyas man chad du yang 'grub /
analyzed: sems bcos legs nas dge ba la zhugs na ni sangs rgyas man chad du yang 'grub /
translated: If my mind is well controlled and I practice virtue, I will attain Buddhahood.

original: sems bcos ma legs te mi dge ba la zhugs na ni ngan song gsum du skye zhing ltung bas /
analyzed: sems bcos ma legs te mi dge ba la zhugs na ni ngan song gsum du skye zhing ltung bas /
translated: If my mind is badly controlled and I practice non-virtue, I will be born in the three miserable destinies and fall.

original: bdag bde legs su 'dod cing /
analyzed: bdag bde legs su 'dod cing /
translated: Therefore, if I desire my own happiness

original: gzhan la yang phan pa dang bde bar bya ba 'dod pas ni rang gi sems legs par bcos shing sbyar dgos so //
analyzed: gzhan la yang phan pa dang bde bar bya ba 'dod pas ni rang gi sems legs par bcos shing sbyar dgos so //
translated: and if I desire to benefit and to make others happy, I must control and apply my mind well.

original: de lta bas na ngan song gsum du mi ltung zhing rtag tu bde skyid la sangs rgyas su grub pa dang / gzhan la yang phan gdags par 'dod pas thog mar ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bas na ngan song gsum du mi ltung zhing rtag tu bde skyid la sangs rgyas su grub pa dang / gzhan la yang phan gdags par 'dod pas thog mar ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: Thus, if I do not want to fall into the three miserable destinies, if I want to be always happy and to attain Buddhahood, and if I want to benefit others, what should I do first?

original: dang por phyag bya ba'i 'os mchod pa'i gnas rnams la /
analyzed: dang por phyag bya ba'i 'os mchod pa'i gnas rnams la /
translated: The first is to bow down to those who are worthy of homage and to make offerings to them.

original: phyag bya ba dang mchod pa'i bsam pas sems sbyangs te /
analyzed: phyag bya ba dang mchod pa'i bsam pas sems sbyangs te /
translated: First, one should train the mind with the thought of paying homage and making offerings to those who are worthy of homage and offerings.

original: sdig pa bshags la dge ba gzhan gyi snod du rung bar bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa bshags la dge ba gzhan gyi snod du rung bar bya'o //
translated: One should confess one's sins and become a fit vessel for virtue.

original: de ltar sems sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir phyag bya ba'i gnas sangs rgyas mngon sum du bzhugs pa dang / sems kyis lhag par mang du dmigs te /
analyzed: de ltar sems sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir phyag bya ba'i gnas sangs rgyas mngon sum du bzhugs pa dang / sems kyis lhag par mang du dmigs te /
translated: In order to train the mind in this way, one should first pay homage to the Buddhas who are present in person and to those one visualizes in the mind.

original: phyag bya bar thog mar gsungs so //
analyzed: phyag bya bar thog mar gsungs so //
translated: This is what is taught.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa la phyag bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa la phyag bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of homage to the Tathagatas:

original: lus dang ngag dang yid gsum char gyis phyag bya ba dang / lus kyis phyag bya ba dang / ngag gis phyag bya ba dang / yid kyis phyag bya @185a * //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid gsum char gyis phyag bya ba dang / lus kyis phyag bya ba dang / ngag gis phyag bya ba dang / yid kyis phyag bya @185a * //
translated: homage with all three, body, speech, and mind; homage with the body; homage with speech; and homage with the mind.

original: ba'o // de la dang po ni /
analyzed: ba'o // de la dang po ni /
translated: The first is as follows:üîΩAll the lion-like men,üîΩall the Tathagatas of the three times,

original: ji snyed su dag phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten na //üîΩdus gsum gshegs pa mi yi seng ge kun //
analyzed: ji snyed su dag phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten na // dus gsum gshegs pa mi yi seng ge kun //
translated: without exception, in all the worlds of the ten directions,

original: bdag gis ma lus de dag thams cad la //
analyzed: bdag gis ma lus de dag thams cad la //
translated: I pay homage to them all.

original: lus dang ngag yid dang bas phyag bgyi'o //üîΩzhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: lus dang ngag yid dang bas phyag bgyi'o // zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: I pay homage with body, speech, and mind.

original: ji snyed dam gang dag su dag pa phyogs 'ga' na bzhugs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams 'ga' na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' la phyag bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: ji snyed dam gang dag su dag pa phyogs 'ga' na bzhugs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams 'ga' na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' la phyag bya ba yin gyi /
translated: This means that I pay homage to any and all Tathagatas who exist in any direction, who exist in any world-system, and to any Tathagata.

original: phyogs bcu kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad bzhugs pa la phyag bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad bzhugs pa la phyag bya'o //
translated: I pay homage to all Tathagatas who exist in all world-systems in all ten directions.

original: 'das pa dang da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus 'ga' zhig na bzhugs pa la phyag bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus 'ga' zhig na bzhugs pa la phyag bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: I do not pay homage to any Tathagata who exists in any direction, in any world-system, in any time, past, present, or future.

original: dus gsum du gshegs pa las te /
analyzed: dus gsum du gshegs pa las te /
translated: I pay homage to all Tathagatas who have gone in the three times.

original: 'das pa'i dus na sangs rgyas par gshegs par gyur pa dang / da ltar gyi dus su sangs rgyas te gshegs pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sangs rgyas te gshegs par 'gyur ba'i sangs rgyas mi'i seng ge gang dag ji snyed pa de dag ma lus pa thams cad la bdag lus btud cing tshig gis bstod yid kyis dmigs nas gus pas phyag bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na sangs rgyas par gshegs par gyur pa dang / da ltar gyi dus su sangs rgyas te gshegs pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sangs rgyas te gshegs par 'gyur ba'i sangs rgyas mi'i seng ge gang dag ji snyed pa de dag ma lus pa thams cad la bdag lus btud cing tshig gis bstod yid kyis dmigs nas gus pas phyag bya ba'o //
translated: I bow down to all the lion-like human beings of the past, present and future, who have become Buddhas, who are becoming Buddhas, and who will become Buddhas.

original: mi'i seng ge zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas dga' ldan gyi gnas nas sems can gyi don du mi'i lus su bstan pa dper na seng ges gcan gzan dang ri dags thams cad zil gyis mnan te bag tsha ba med pa ltar /
analyzed: mi'i seng ge zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas dga' ldan gyi gnas nas sems can gyi don du mi'i lus su bstan pa dper na seng ges gcan gzan dang ri dags thams cad zil gyis mnan te bag tsha ba med pa ltar /
translated: The lion-like human beings are the Tathagatas who, for the sake of sentient beings, have manifested in human form from the Tusita heaven. For example, a lion is fearless in overpowering all the wild animals and deer.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas kyang bdud dang mu stegs can phyir rgol ba lha dang mi thams cad zil gyis mnan te su la yang bag tsha ba 'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas kyang bdud dang mu stegs can phyir rgol ba lha dang mi thams cad zil gyis mnan te su la yang bag tsha ba 'am /
translated: In the same way, the Tathagatas, too, are fearless in overpowering all the demons, tirthikas, opponents, gods and humans.

original: bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ste /
translated: They are fearless in regard to anyone.

original: mkhyen pa'i mthu'i yon tan thams cad kyis 'phags pa la bya'o //
analyzed: mkhyen pa'i mthu'i yon tan thams cad kyis 'phags pa la bya'o //
translated: The qualities of the power of knowledge are all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: lus dang ngag yid dang bas zhes pa ni gzhan gyi yams la bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: lus dang ngag yid dang bas zhes pa ni gzhan gyi yams la bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: The phrase with a body, speech, and mind full of devotion does not refer to devotion to others,

original: bdag nyid dang bas sangs rgyas kyi sku la yid kyis sems shing ngag gis bstod de lus btud nas gus pas phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bdag nyid dang bas sangs rgyas kyi sku la yid kyis sems shing ngag gis bstod de lus btud nas gus pas phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: but to devotion to oneself, thinking of the Buddha's body with the mind, praising him with speech, and bowing with the body.

original: gal te ci'i phyir mi'i seng ge mang po de snyed la phyag bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ci'i phyir mi'i seng ge mang po de snyed la phyag bya zhe na /
translated: If you ask, Why should I bow to so many lion-like humans?

original: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa mnga' ba dang phyag bya ba'i gnas su gyur pas gcig la phyag nas na yang bsod nams chen po thob na mang po la phyag byas nas bsod nams ches mang du thob pas de'i phyir de dag thams cad la phyag bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa mnga' ba dang phyag bya ba'i gnas su gyur pas gcig la phyag nas na yang bsod nams chen po thob na mang po la phyag byas nas bsod nams ches mang du thob pas de'i phyir de dag thams cad la phyag bya'o //
translated: If you obtain great merit by bowing to even one of them, who is endowed with the perfection of good qualities and is worthy of homage, then you will obtain even more merit by bowing to many of them. Therefore, you should bow to all of them.

original: gnyis pa lus kyis phyag bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa lus kyis phyag bya ba ni /
translated: The second, the physical prostration, is

original: bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam stobs dag @185b gis //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam stobs dag @185b gis //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: the power of the prayer for good conduct.

original: lus kyis phyag bya ba'i yul yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: lus kyis phyag bya ba'i yul yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the object of prostration with the body?

original: bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam ni byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang pos gsungs pa'i smon lam mo //
analyzed: bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam ni byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang pos gsungs pa'i smon lam mo //
translated: The prayer of good practice is the prayer spoken by the bodhisattva Samantabhadra.

original: stobs ni man ngag ste /
analyzed: stobs ni man ngag ste /
translated: Power is the instruction.

original: smon lam 'di las 'byung ba'i man ngag go //
analyzed: smon lam 'di las 'byung ba'i man ngag go //
translated: The instruction that arises from this prayer.

original: yang na bzang po spyod pa la smon pa'i stobs kyis phyag bya'o zhes bya bar bshad de /
analyzed: yang na bzang po spyod pa la smon pa'i stobs kyis phyag bya'o zhes bya bar bshad de /
translated: Or, it is explained that one should prostrate with the power of aspiring to good practice.

original: bzang po spyod pa ni gong du bshad zin to //
analyzed: bzang po spyod pa ni gong du bshad zin to //
translated: Good practice has already been explained above.

original: der smon pa ni der sems 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: der smon pa ni der sems 'dun pa'o //
translated: Aspiring to that is directing the mind to that.

original: smon pa'i stobs kyis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par g-yeng ba spangs nas sems rtse gcig tu bya ba la zhugs par ro //
analyzed: smon pa'i stobs kyis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par g-yeng ba spangs nas sems rtse gcig tu bya ba la zhugs par ro //
translated: By the power of aspiration, having abandoned the opposing factors of distraction, one engages in making the mind one-pointed.

original: rgyal ba thams cad yid kyis mngon sum du //
analyzed: rgyal ba thams cad yid kyis mngon sum du //
translated: All the victors, in the presence of my mind,

original: zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dgra las rgyal ba'i sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dgra las rgyal ba'i sangs rgyas te /
translated: The buddhas are victors over the enemy of afflictions.

original: yid dam sems kyis phyogs bcu dang dus gsum du gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad mngon sum du mthong ba dang 'dra bar dmigs so //
analyzed: yid dam sems kyis phyogs bcu dang dus gsum du gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad mngon sum du mthong ba dang 'dra bar dmigs so //
translated: The mind, the heart, perceives all the Buddhas who have gone to the ten directions and the three times, as if it were seeing them face to face.

original: zhing gi rdul snyed lus rab btud pa yi //üîΩzhes bya ba ni rgyal ba de dag gi zhing thams cad ji snyed yod pa de snyed du bdag gi lus mang por gyur par bsam pa'o //
analyzed: zhing gi rdul snyed lus rab btud pa yi // zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba de dag gi zhing thams cad ji snyed yod pa de snyed du bdag gi lus mang por gyur par bsam pa'o //
translated: With bodies as numerous as the atoms in the Buddha-fields,

original: rgyal ba kun la rab tu phyag 'tshal lo //

original: zhes pa la ni bla na med pa'i byang chub rim par sa bcu dag las rnam par sangs rgyas pa ni dang po byang chub mchog tu thugs bskyed pa nas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: zhes pa la ni bla na med pa'i byang chub rim par sa bcu dag las rnam par sangs rgyas pa ni dang po byang chub mchog tu thugs bskyed pa nas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /

original: ma chags zhes pa ni da ltar gter brnyes kyang de la so so'i skye bo ltar chags shing zhen pa mi mnga' bas ma chags brnyes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma chags zhes pa ni da ltar gter brnyes kyang de la so so'i skye bo ltar chags shing zhen pa mi mnga' bas ma chags brnyes zhes bya'o //

original: mgon po de dag bdag gis thams cad la //
analyzed: mgon po de dag bdag gis thams cad la //

analyzed: zhes pa la mgon ni sems can thams cad kyi skyabs dang dpung gnyen te /

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sems can skye ba dang / rga ba dang na ba dang / 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnams kyis nyen pa mgon dang skyabs med pa rnams la 'phral dang yun du phan pa dang / bde bar 'gyur ba'i mgon mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sems can skye ba dang / rga ba dang na ba dang / 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnams kyis nyen pa mgon dang skyabs med pa rnams la 'phral dang yun du phan pa dang / bde bar 'gyur ba'i mgon mdzad pa'o //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn buddhas are protectors for sentient beings who are afflicted by the sufferings of birth, aging, sickness, death, and so on, and who are without a protector or refuge. They are protectors who bring immediate and lasting benefit and happiness.

original: 'khor lo bla na med pa bskor bar bskul //
analyzed: 'khor lo bla na med pa bskor bar bskul //

original: zhes pa la 'khor lo ni dper na shing rta'i 'phang lo 'dri la zhing 'gro ba la yang @191a * //
analyzed: zhes pa la 'khor lo ni dper na shing rta'i 'phang lo 'dri la zhing 'gro ba la yang @191a * //

analyzed: 'khor lo 'gro ba dang 'dra bar chos ston pa dang / pha rol nyan pa dag gi rgyud la yang dag pa'i don go bar byed pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma is like the movement of the wheel, and it causes the understanding of the true meaning in the mindstreams of the disciples who listen.

original: bla na med pa zhes pa ni 'dra ba'am gong na med pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa zhes pa ni 'dra ba'am gong na med pa'o //

original: bskor ba zhes pa ni chos bshad pa ste /
analyzed: bskor ba zhes pa ni chos bshad pa ste /

original: gzhan gyi sems la go bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems la go bar byed pa'o //

original: bskul ba ni chos bshad du bskul dgos pas /
analyzed: bskul ba ni chos bshad du bskul dgos pas /

analyzed: sangs rgyas mngon sum dang 'dra bar dmigs te /

original: rgyal ba sangs rgyas la ni mi mkhyen pa'am /
analyzed: rgyal ba sangs rgyas la ni mi mkhyen pa'am /

original: mi gzigs pa'am //
analyzed: mi gzigs pa'am //

analyzed: mya ngan 'das ston gang bzhed de dag las //

original: zhes pa ste /

translated: One dedicates all one's accumulated merit to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, having made it common to oneself and all sentient beings, by way of the thought of rejoicing in the merit of all noble beings and of all ordinary beings, by way of the thought of requesting the turning of the wheel of Dharma, and by way of the thought of requesting the buddhas not to pass into nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: de la rten gyi sgo nas yongs su dag par bsam pa ni 'jig rten gyi khams na ngan grog dang / g-yang sa dang / chor ma dang / khrag khrog dang / mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i ming yang mi grag cing /
analyzed: de la rten gyi sgo nas yongs su dag par bsam pa ni 'jig rten gyi khams na ngan grog dang / g-yang sa dang / chor ma dang / khrag khrog dang / mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i ming yang mi grag cing /

analyzed: ngan song gsum dang mi khom pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi sgra yang med /

analyzed: bkres pa dang / skom pa'i sgra yang med ces bya ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams de cang de yang lag mthil ltar mnyam zhing beed'urya sngon po'i sa gzhi la rin po che thams cad kyi padmas rab tu smras te /

analyzed: gling bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum phrag drug cu yod de /

original: byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam gyis nyi ma dang zla ba gcig gi 'od kyis kun du snang zhes bya ba dang / mi 'khrugs pa bkod pa'i mdo dang / 'od dpag tu med pa'i zhing gi bkod pa'i mdo las ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //

original: brten pa'i sgo nas yongs su dag pa ni /
analyzed: brten pa'i sgo nas yongs su dag pa ni /

original: shing gi rgyal po byang chub kyi shing drung du gshegs nas sangs rgyas par gyur ba'i sangs rgyas rnams dang / sras byang chub sems @193a * //
analyzed: shing gi rgyal po byang chub kyi shing drung du gshegs nas sangs rgyas par gyur ba'i sangs rgyas rnams dang / sras byang chub sems @193a * //

analyzed: dpa' rnams kyis zhing de rab tu gang ba ste /

original: de ltar gyur cig par bsam mo //
analyzed: de ltar gyur cig par bsam mo //

original: sems can la phan pa dang bde bar bsam pa ni /
analyzed: sems can la phan pa dang bde bar bsam pa ni /

original: phyogs bcu'i sems can ma lus pa bsdus pa ni ji snyed pa de dag thams cad rtag tu nad med par gyur cig ces bya ba ni de rtag tu lus dang sems la gnod pa'i nad dang / sdug bsngal med par gyur cig pa'o //

analyzed: bde bar gyur zhes pa ni de dag rtag tu ngan song gi sdug bsngal la sogs pa kun dang bral ba ste /

analyzed: bde skyid dam pa dang bral bar ma gyur cig pa'o //

original: 'gro ba kun gyi chos kyi don rnams ni //üîΩzhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'gro ba kun gyi chos kyi don rnams ni // zhes pa ni /

analyzed: byang chub spyod pa dag ni bdag spyod cing // zhes pa nas //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rlabs po che pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bdag spyod de de grub cing /

original: 'gro ba kun du skye bar dran par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gro ba kun du skye bar dran par 'gyur //

original: rtag tu rab tu 'byung bar gyur @193b cig ces smos te /
analyzed: rtag tu rab tu 'byung bar gyur @193b cig ces smos te /
translated: In all my births, from one life to the next, may I never be attached to home life, but always intent on going forth.

analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gcig po de ni byang chub kyi sems mi brjed par bya ba'i rgyu dang po yin no //

original: de bzhin du //
analyzed: de bzhin du //
translated: And so

analyzed: rgyal ba kun gyi rjes su slob gyur te //

translated: This means that one practices in accordance with the training of all the Victorious Ones who have come in the three times, and will train, and are training.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni //
translated: The line ‚ÄúI will complete the conduct of good actions‚Äù and so forth

analyzed: bzang po spyod pa ni gong du bshad pa dang 'dra ste /

analyzed: spyod pa de yongs su rdzogs shing mthar phyin par bya ba'o //
translated: One should complete that conduct and bring it to perfection.

analyzed: de yongs su rdzogs par byed pas ci zhig bya zhe na / tshul khrims spyod pa dri med yongs dag par //

original: ces bya ba'i spyod pa de lta bu la bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i spyod pa de lta bu la bya'o //

original: bsil bar byed pas bsil byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: bsil bar byed pas bsil byed ces bya'o //

analyzed: theg pa dman par sems bskyed pa dang bral zhing thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa dang ldan pas yongs su dag pa'o //

original: lha yi skad dang klu dang gnod sbyin skad //
analyzed: lha yi skad dang klu dang gnod sbyin skad //
translated: The language of the gods, the language of the nagas, the language of the yaksas,

original: ces pa nas /
analyzed: ces pa nas /
translated: up to

original: thams cad skad du bdag gis chos bstan to //
analyzed: thams cad skad du bdag gis chos bstan to //
translated: I teach the Dharma in all languages.üîΩThe verse which occurs between the two preceding verses and

original: zhes pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni tshig gong ma gnyis kyi bar du 'byung ba dang / tshul khrims bsrungs pas bdag gi sems kyi rgyud dag par byas nas //
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni tshig gong ma gnyis kyi bar du 'byung ba dang / tshul khrims bsrungs pas bdag gi sems kyi rgyud dag par byas nas //
translated: having purified my mental continuum by guarding morality,

analyzed: de gzhan la phan gdags par bstan pa ste /
translated: I teach it to others for the sake of benefit.

original: sems can tha dad pa ji snyed @194a * //
analyzed: sems can tha dad pa ji snyed @194a * //
translated: As many different sentient beings there are,üîΩ

analyzed: yod pa'i skad mtha' dag shes nas de dag so so'i skad kyis de dag thams cad la rtag tu ston par gyur cig pa'o //

analyzed: 'di ni byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa'i rgyu gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third cause for not forgetting the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: nges shing pha rol phyin la rab brtson te //üîΩzhes pa ni /
analyzed: nges shing pha rol phyin la rab brtson te // zhes pa ni /
translated: Firmly, and striving in the perfections,

original: nges pa ni sems can rnams la sems mnyan pa ste /
analyzed: nges pa ni sems can rnams la sems mnyan pa ste /
translated: Firmly means having an attitude of equality toward sentient beings,

original: snying rje zhing 'grogs na bde ba'o //
analyzed: snying rje zhing 'grogs na bde ba'o //
translated: and being compassionate and pleasant to be with.

original: pha rol tu pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa bcu'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa bcu'o //
translated: The perfections are the ten beginning with giving.

original: de la brtson pa ni yongs su mi skyo bar de la sbyor bar gyur cig pa'o //
analyzed: de la brtson pa ni yongs su mi skyo bar de la sbyor bar gyur cig pa'o //
translated: Striving in them means being engaged in them without getting discouraged.

original: byang chub sems ni nams kyang brjed ma gyur //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni nams kyang brjed ma gyur //
translated: May I never forget the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: zhes pa la byang chub sems ni bla na med pa'i byang chub gong du smos pa lta bu 'dod cing /
analyzed: zhes pa la byang chub sems ni bla na med pa'i byang chub gong du smos pa lta bu 'dod cing /
translated: The Thought of Enlightenment is the desire for the unsurpassable enlightenment mentioned above,

original: sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde bar bya bar smon pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde bar bya bar smon pa'o //
translated: and the aspiration to bring about the benefit and happiness of sentient beings.

original: de'i rtsa ba ni snying rje'o //
analyzed: de'i rtsa ba ni snying rje'o //
translated: Its root is compassion.

original: sems de yang kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems dang / don dam pa byang chub kyi sems gnyis te /
analyzed: sems de yang kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems dang / don dam pa byang chub kyi sems gnyis te /
translated: The mind is twofold: the relative mind of enlightenment and the ultimate mind of enlightenment.

original: de la kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems ni sems can 'khor ba las ma brgal ba rnams bsgral ba dang / nyon mongs pa las ma grol ba rnams la sgrol ba dang / sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba rnams dbugs dbyung ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa rnams yongs su mya ngan las bzla'o //
analyzed: de la kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems ni sems can 'khor ba las ma brgal ba rnams bsgral ba dang / nyon mongs pa las ma grol ba rnams la sgrol ba dang / sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba rnams dbugs dbyung ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa rnams yongs su mya ngan las bzla'o //
translated: The relative mind of enlightenment is the thought: ‚ÄúI will liberate those sentient beings who have not crossed over from cyclic existence, I will liberate those who have not been liberated from the afflictions, I will comfort those who are tormented by suffering, and I will lead to complete nirvana those who have not attained complete nirvana.‚Äù

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ma thob pa rnams thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya'o snyam du sems shing /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ma thob pa rnams thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya'o snyam du sems shing /
translated: ‚ÄúI will cause those who have not attained the exalted wisdom of omniscience to attain the exalted wisdom of omniscience.‚Äù

original: 'gro ba la phan pa'i phyir bdag sangs rgyas su grub par shog shig ces smon pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba la phan pa'i phyir bdag sangs rgyas su grub par shog shig ces smon pa'o //
translated: Thus, one aspires to become a buddha in order to benefit migrating beings.

original: don dam pa'i sems ni chos thams cad bdag med pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyi rang bzhin sems gzod ma nas ma skyes la /
analyzed: don dam pa'i sems ni chos thams cad bdag med pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyi rang bzhin sems gzod ma nas ma skyes la /
translated: The ultimate mind of enlightenment is the nature of the equality of the selflessness of all phenomena, the mind that is primordially unborn.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du smos pa dang / rtogs shing mngon par 'gyur te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du smos pa dang / rtogs shing mngon par 'gyur te /
translated: and the nature of emptiness.

original: des shing pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la brtson par byed pas byang chub thob kyi bar du byang chub kyi sems de lta bu rtsa ba dang bcas pa rnam par brjed par ma gyur cig pa'o //
analyzed: des shing pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la brtson par byed pas byang chub thob kyi bar du byang chub kyi sems de lta bu rtsa ba dang bcas pa rnam par brjed par ma gyur cig pa'o //
translated: And may I never forget such a thought of enlightenment, from the time when I first produce it until I reach the terrace of enlightenment.

original: tshig rkang gnyis po des ni byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa'i rgyu bzhi po yin te /
analyzed: tshig rkang gnyis po des ni byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa'i rgyu bzhi po yin te /
translated: These two lines show the four causes for not forgetting the thought of enlightenment.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang bzhis ni byang chub kyi sems mi brjed par bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs sgrib pa rnams kyi gnyen po bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang bzhis ni byang chub kyi sems mi brjed par bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs sgrib pa rnams kyi gnyen po bstan to //
translated: Thus, in the first half of the verse, the author shows the antidotes to the obscurations which are adverse to not forgetting the thought of enlightenment.üîΩWhatever sins have become obscurations,

original: sdig pa gang rnams sgrib par gyur pa dag / de dag ma lus yongs su byang bar shog /
analyzed: sdig pa gang rnams sgrib par gyur pa dag / de dag ma lus yongs su byang bar shog /
translated: may they all be completely purified.

original: @194b ces pa'i tshig rkang gnyis po des ni byang chub kyi sems kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa bstan te /
analyzed: @194b ces pa'i tshig rkang gnyis po des ni byang chub kyi sems kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa bstan te /
translated: These two lines show the abandonment of the adverse side of the thought of enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi sems la sgrib cing bar chad byed pa'i sdig pa ni 'dod chags zhe sdang la sogs pa yin pas de dag thams cad ma lus par byang bar gyur cig pa'o /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems la sgrib cing bar chad byed pa'i sdig pa ni 'dod chags zhe sdang la sogs pa yin pas de dag thams cad ma lus par byang bar gyur cig pa'o /
translated: The sins that obstruct and create obstacles to the Thought of Enlightenment are attachment, hatred, and so on.

original: // / gsum pa mi chags par sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: // / gsum pa mi chags par sbyor ba ni /
translated: The third, the application of non-attachment,

original: gang la mi chags par ston te gang la mi chags par sbyor zhe na /
analyzed: gang la mi chags par ston te gang la mi chags par sbyor zhe na /
translated: is taught in the line:

original: las dang nyon mongs bdud kyi las rnams las //üîΩzhes pa ni /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs bdud kyi las rnams las // zhes pa ni /
translated: From actions, afflictions, and the works of Mara.

original: las ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mi g-yo ba dang gsum yod pa las mi dge ba la bya'o //
analyzed: las ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mi g-yo ba dang gsum yod pa las mi dge ba la bya'o //
translated: Actions are the three: virtuous, non-virtuous, and neutral.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa lus dang sems nyon mongs par byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa lus dang sems nyon mongs par byed pa rnams so //
translated: Afflictions are those which afflict body and mind, such as attachment.

original: bdud ni dge ba'i srog gi bar chad byed pa byang chub dang mi mthun par byed cing dam pa'i chos log par byed pa ste /
analyzed: bdud ni dge ba'i srog gi bar chad byed pa byang chub dang mi mthun par byed cing dam pa'i chos log par byed pa ste /
translated: Mara is that which creates obstacles to the life of virtue, which acts in opposition to enlightenment, and which misleads the holy Dharma.

original: chos kyis 'tsho ba'i bar chod byed cing gsod pas bdud do //
analyzed: chos kyis 'tsho ba'i bar chod byed cing gsod pas bdud do //
translated: Since it creates obstacles and kills the life of Dharma, it is Mara.

original: de'i lam mam las ni phan pa dang bde ba med par zhugs pa dang / phan pa'i dngos po la rgyus rnam pa tho 'tshams shing 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag la spyod du 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de'i lam mam las ni phan pa dang bde ba med par zhugs pa dang / phan pa'i dngos po la rgyus rnam pa tho 'tshams shing 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag la spyod du 'jug pa ste /
translated: Its path or action is to engage in what is harmful and not beneficial, and to cause one to engage in the five sense pleasures, having no regard for what is beneficial.

original: de ltar na las dang nyon mongs pa dang bud kyi las ni 'khor bar 'ching ba yin pas /
analyzed: de ltar na las dang nyon mongs pa dang bud kyi las ni 'khor bar 'ching ba yin pas /
translated: Thus, the action, affliction, and birth are the bonds of cyclic existence.

original: 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba dag la gnas pa'i tshe de las grol zhing de dag gi mi chags par de dag dbang du mi 'gyur bar spyod par gyur cig pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba dag la gnas pa'i tshe de las grol zhing de dag gi mi chags par de dag dbang du mi 'gyur bar spyod par gyur cig pa'o //
translated: Therefore, when abiding in the migrations of the world, may I be free from them, and not be attached to them, so that I may act without being controlled by them.

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: grol zhing 'jig rten 'gro ba rnams su yang //
analyzed: grol zhing 'jig rten 'gro ba rnams su yang //
translated: Free, and in the migrations of the world.

original: zhes pa ni 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba lha la sogs pa 'gro ba lnga po dag na gnas pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba lha la sogs pa 'gro ba lnga po dag na gnas pa'i tshe'o //
translated: The migrations of the world are the five migrations of gods and so on.

original: ji ltar mi chags par sbyor zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi chags par sbyor zhe na /
translated: How is one unattached?

original: ji ltar padma chus mi chags pa bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar padma chus mi chags pa bzhin //
translated: Like a lotus, unattached to water.

original: zhes pa ni sbyong bar shog cig par sbyar te dper na padma chu las skyes kyang chu dang 'dab rdzab kyis mi gos pa bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sbyong bar shog cig par sbyar te dper na padma chu las skyes kyang chu dang 'dab rdzab kyis mi gos pa bzhin du /
translated: This is to be applied as ‚ÄúMay they practice,‚Äù and it means that just as a lotus is born from the mud but is not soiled by the water or mud,

original: 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba dag na gnas kyang mi dge ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa dang / bdud kyi lam gyis mi gos par spyod par gyur cig pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba dag na gnas kyang mi dge ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa dang / bdud kyi lam gyis mi gos par spyod par gyur cig pa'o //
translated: so may they practice without being soiled by nonvirtuous actions, afflictions, or the ways of Mara, even though they live in the world.

original: las dge ba dang mi g-yo ba'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la re ba med cing chags pa med par 'gro ba rnams kyi don 'ba' zhig byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yin te /üîΩdper na / nyi zla nam mkhar @195a * //
analyzed: las dge ba dang mi g-yo ba'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la re ba med cing chags pa med par 'gro ba rnams kyi don 'ba' zhig byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yin te / dper na / nyi zla nam mkhar @195a * //
translated: The practice of the bodhisattva is to work solely for the welfare of beings, without hope and without attachment to the results of virtuous actions and immovable actions.

original: thogs pa med ltar spyod //
analyzed: thogs pa med ltar spyod //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúPractice like the sun and moon in the sky.‚ÄùüîΩThis is to be applied as ‚ÄúPractice like the sun and moon in the sky,‚Äù

original: ces sbyar ba yin te /
analyzed: ces sbyar ba yin te /
translated: and it means thatüîΩjust as the sun and moon move through the sky without obstruction,

original: dper na nyi zla ni gzhan gyi don byed cing rtag tu nam mkha' la thogs pa med cing lan la mi re ba bzhin du bdag kyang sems can la phan pa dang bde ba'i don spyad kyang lan la mi re zhing chags pa med pa kho nar spyodüîΩpar gyur cig pa'o /
analyzed: dper na nyi zla ni gzhan gyi don byed cing rtag tu nam mkha' la thogs pa med cing lan la mi re ba bzhin du bdag kyang sems can la phan pa dang bde ba'i don spyad kyang lan la mi re zhing chags pa med pa kho nar spyod par gyur cig pa'o /
translated: Just as the sun and moon work for the benefit of others, always moving through the sky without obstruction and without any expectation of reward, may I too work for the benefit and happiness of sentient beings, without any expectation of reward and with complete detachment.

original: // / da ni bzhi pa tshe 'di dang tshe phyi mar sems can ma lus pa la phan gdags pa ni /
analyzed: // / da ni bzhi pa tshe 'di dang tshe phyi mar sems can ma lus pa la phan gdags pa ni /
translated: Now, the fourth, bringing benefit to all sentient beings in this and future lives, is presented in the following:

original: zhing gi khyon dang phyogs rnams ji tsam par //
analyzed: zhing gi khyon dang phyogs rnams ji tsam par //
translated: To the limits of space,

original: ngan song sdug bsngal rab tu zhi bar byed //üîΩces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ngan song sdug bsngal rab tu zhi bar byed // ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: May the sufferings of the lower realms be pacified.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi khyon phyogs bcu ji tsam yod pa de dag thams cad du ngan song gi sdug bsngal mtha' dag zhi bar gyur cig pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi khyon phyogs bcu ji tsam yod pa de dag thams cad du ngan song gi sdug bsngal mtha' dag zhi bar gyur cig pa'o //
translated: To the limits of space, in all the ten directions, may the sufferings of the lower realms be pacified.

original: ngan song ni bde 'gro las ltung ste 'og tu song ba de'i sdug bsngal mi bzad cing drag pas de zhi bar bya ba'i phyir smos su zin kyang khams gsum sdug bsngal kun zhi par bya'o nyam pa'o //
analyzed: ngan song ni bde 'gro las ltung ste 'og tu song ba de'i sdug bsngal mi bzad cing drag pas de zhi bar bya ba'i phyir smos su zin kyang khams gsum sdug bsngal kun zhi par bya'o nyam pa'o //
translated: The lower realms are the fall from happy rebirth, and the suffering of that fall is unbearable and intense. Even though it is mentioned in order to pacify that, still, the suffering of the three realms is to be pacified.üîΩTo set all beings in happiness

original: bde ba dag la 'gro ba kun dgod cing //
analyzed: bde ba dag la 'gro ba kun dgod cing //
translated: And to establish all beings in happiness,üîΩ

original: zhes bya bas kyang sdug bsngal zhi bar byas nas /
analyzed: zhes bya bas kyang sdug bsngal zhi bar byas nas /
translated: Having pacified suffering,

original: yang tshe 'di la 'gro ba thams cad bde bar gyur cig pa'o //
analyzed: yang tshe 'di la 'gro ba thams cad bde bar gyur cig pa'o //
translated: may all beings in the world be happy.

original: 'gro ba thams cad la ni phan par spyad //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad la ni phan par spyad //
translated: To benefit all beingsüîΩ.

original: ces pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yang sems can kun la phan par spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: ces pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yang sems can kun la phan par spyad par bya ste /
translated: In the future, too, I will act to benefit all sentient beings.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub la dgod par bya zhing /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub la dgod par bya zhing /
translated: I will establish them in unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: yongs su mi skyo bar byang chub thob par gyur cig pa'o /
analyzed: yongs su mi skyo bar byang chub thob par gyur cig pa'o /
translated: May I attain enlightenment without getting discouraged.üîΩThe armor

original: // / lnga pa go cha bgo ba la gsum ste /
analyzed: // / lnga pa go cha bgo ba la gsum ste /
translated: 5. Donning the ArmorüîΩ

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can gyi spyod pa dang mthun par 'jug par bya ba dang / dam pa'i chos rab tu bstan par bya ba'o //üîΩde la sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par bya ba ni /üîΩbyang chub spyod pa yongs su rdzogs byed cing //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can gyi spyod pa dang mthun par 'jug par bya ba dang / dam pa'i chos rab tu bstan par bya ba'o // de la sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par bya ba ni / byang chub spyod pa yongs su rdzogs byed cing //
translated: To perfect the qualities of a Buddha

original: zhes pa bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa bya ste /
translated: is explained by the following:üîΩ‚ÄúThey perfect the conduct of enlightenment.‚Äù

original: byang chub kyis spyod pa ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyis spyod pa ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The conduct of enlightenment is as explained above.

analyzed: de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba ni bsgrub pa'o // sems can spyod pa dang mthun par 'jug pa ni /
translated: To perfect it is to accomplish it.

original: sems can kun gyi spyod dang mthun par 'jug /
analyzed: sems can kun gyi spyod dang mthun par 'jug /
translated: To act in accordance with the conduct of sentient beings

original: ces pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ste /
translated: is explained by the following:üîΩ‚ÄúThey act in accordance with the conduct of all sentient beings.‚Äù

original: sems can rnams la tshe rabs thams cad du g-yo sgyu med pa'i rang bzhin dag /
analyzed: sems can rnams la tshe rabs thams cad du g-yo sgyu med pa'i rang bzhin dag /
translated: To sentient beings, in all their lives, they are by nature free of deceit and pretense.

original: bka' blo bde ba yid dang mthun par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bka' blo bde ba yid dang mthun par spyod pa'o //
translated: They are agreeable to work with, and their advice is well received.üîΩTo teach the sublime Dharma

original: dam @195b pa'i chos rab tu bstan par bya ba ni /
analyzed: dam @195b pa'i chos rab tu bstan par bya ba ni /
translated: is explained by the following:

original: bzang po spyod pa dag ni rab ston zhing //
analyzed: bzang po spyod pa dag ni rab ston zhing //
translated: ‚ÄúThey teach the conduct of goodness.‚Äù

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: Thus,

analyzed: spyod pa bzang po rlabs po che byang chub sems dpa'i spyod par rab tu ston cing sgrogs par byed pa'o //
translated: he teaches and proclaims the bodhisattva's conduct, which is a great wave of excellent conduct.

original: ma 'ongs bskal ba kun du spyod par 'gyur //
analyzed: ma 'ongs bskal ba kun du spyod par 'gyur //
translated: He will practice for all ages to come.

original: zhes pa ni gsum char dang sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni gsum char dang sbyar te /
translated: This is to be applied to all three.

original: dus de srid du mi skyo bar rtag tu spyod par bya'o //
analyzed: dus de srid du mi skyo bar rtag tu spyod par bya'o //
translated: He will practice constantly without weariness for that length of time.

original: bskal ba zhes pa ni bar gyi bskal ba la sogs pa bskal ba mang ste /üîΩde bskal ba dang po ni mi'i tshe lo dpag tu med pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: bskal ba zhes pa ni bar gyi bskal ba la sogs pa bskal ba mang ste / de bskal ba dang po ni mi'i tshe lo dpag tu med pa nas bzung ste /
translated: An age is many ages, such as an intermediate age and so forth.üîΩThe first age is from the time when the human life span is immeasurable until it decreases to ten years.

original: rim gyis tshe lo bcu pa'i bar du mar 'grib pa de ni bar gyi bskal ba gcig go //
analyzed: rim gyis tshe lo bcu pa'i bar du mar 'grib pa de ni bar gyi bskal ba gcig go //
translated: That is one intermediate age.

original: yang de ni tshe lo brgyad khri'i bar du gyur la /
analyzed: yang de ni tshe lo brgyad khri'i bar du gyur la /
translated: Then it increases to eighty thousand years.üîΩFrom that, it decreases by the same amount as it increased, until it decreases to ten years.

original: 'grib pa'i rim gyis tshe lo bcu par gyur ba'i bar de ni yar skye ba dang mar 'grib pa zhes bya ba bar gyi bskal ba gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: 'grib pa'i rim gyis tshe lo bcu par gyur ba'i bar de ni yar skye ba dang mar 'grib pa zhes bya ba bar gyi bskal ba gnyis pa ste /
translated: That is the second intermediate age, called increase and decrease.

original: bar gyi bskal ba brgyad cu la bskal ba chen po gcig go //
analyzed: bar gyi bskal ba brgyad cu la bskal ba chen po gcig go //
translated: Eighty intermediate ages are one great age.

original: de la sogs pa bskal ba chen po dpag tu med par gyur cig pa'o //
analyzed: de la sogs pa bskal ba chen po dpag tu med par gyur cig pa'o //
translated: May I and those bodhisattvas who are my spiritual companions have such conduct for countless great eons.

original: / da ni drug pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyi spyod pa dang smon lam ma dag gis skal ba mthun pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang 'grogs par bya ba ni /
analyzed: / da ni drug pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyi spyod pa dang smon lam ma dag gis skal ba mthun pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang 'grogs par bya ba ni /
translated: Now, the sixth, associating with bodhisattvas who are spiritual companions through impure conduct of body, speech and mind and aspirations, is as follows.

original: bdag gi spyod pa zhes pa byang chub sems dpa' gang dag bdag dang spyod pa mtshungs shing 'dra ba de dag bdag kyang byang chub kyi bar du rtag tu lhan cig phrad cing 'grogs par shog cig pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi spyod pa zhes pa byang chub sems dpa' gang dag bdag dang spyod pa mtshungs shing 'dra ba de dag bdag kyang byang chub kyi bar du rtag tu lhan cig phrad cing 'grogs par shog cig pa'o //
translated: May I and those bodhisattvas who are my spiritual companions, who have similar and equal conduct, always meet and associate with each other until enlightenment.

original: lus dang nga dang yid kyis kyang de dag kho na dang lhan cig khong khro la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gnas pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gcig pa dang / smon lam gcig tu spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no /
analyzed: lus dang nga dang yid kyis kyang de dag kho na dang lhan cig khong khro la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gnas pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gcig pa dang / smon lam gcig tu spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no /
translated: And with body, speech and mind, may I and they alone, through abiding without the afflictions of anger and so forth, practice the same bodhisattva conduct and the same aspiration.

original: // / bdun pa phan par sems dpa'i gdams ngag bzhin du bsgrubs pa dag gis dge ba'i bshes gnyen mgu bar bya ba ni /
analyzed: // / bdun pa phan par sems dpa'i gdams ngag bzhin du bsgrubs pa dag gis dge ba'i bshes gnyen mgu bar bya ba ni /
translated: 7. Being pleasing to the spiritual masters by practicing according to their instructions, which are given with the intention of being helpful.

original: bdag la phan par 'dod pa'i grogs po gang //üîΩzhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag la phan par 'dod pa'i grogs po gang // zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The spiritual masters, the good friends who wish to help me,

original: bdag la phan par 'dod pa'i grogs dge ba'i bshes gnyen bzang po spyod pa ston cing 'chad par byed pa chos smra ba gang dag yin pa de dag dang rtag tu 'grogs pa dang / de dag rnams kyang res 'ga' yang cung zad kyang yid mi 'byung zhing @196a * //
analyzed: bdag la phan par 'dod pa'i grogs dge ba'i bshes gnyen bzang po spyod pa ston cing 'chad par byed pa chos smra ba gang dag yin pa de dag dang rtag tu 'grogs pa dang / de dag rnams kyang res 'ga' yang cung zad kyang yid mi 'byung zhing @196a * //
translated: The spiritual masters, the good friends who wish to help me, the Dharma teachers who show and explain the right conduct, I will always be with them, and they will never be displeased with me even for a moment.

original: byang chub kyi bar du dus thams cad du mthun par 'jug par gyur cig ces bya ba yin no /
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar du dus thams cad du mthun par 'jug par gyur cig ces bya ba yin no /
translated: May they always be in harmony with me until enlightenment.

original: // / brgyad pa de bzhin gshegs pa mngon sum du bya ba ni 'khor dang dus dang mi skyo ba dang / mchod par bya ba dag gis so //
analyzed: // / brgyad pa de bzhin gshegs pa mngon sum du bya ba ni 'khor dang dus dang mi skyo ba dang / mchod par bya ba dag gis so //
translated: 8. Being in the presence of the Tathagata, by means of retinue, time, indefatigability, and worship.

original: de dang po 'khor ni /
analyzed: de dang po 'khor ni /
translated: The first of these, the retinue, is indicated by

original: sangs rgyas sras kyis bskor ba'i mgon po rnams //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras kyis bskor ba'i mgon po rnams //
translated: The protectors, surrounded by the Buddha's sons,

original: mngon sum rtag tu bdag gis rgyal ba blta //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: mngon sum rtag tu bdag gis rgyal ba blta // zhes pa ste /
translated: I will always behold the Victor in actuality.

original: phyogs bcu kun gyi rgyal ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyis bskor ba'i mgon po 'gro ba'i gnyen gcig pu la rab rib la sogs pa med pa'i lha'i mig gis rtag tu mngon sum du lhag ger blta zhing /
analyzed: phyogs bcu kun gyi rgyal ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyis bskor ba'i mgon po 'gro ba'i gnyen gcig pu la rab rib la sogs pa med pa'i lha'i mig gis rtag tu mngon sum du lhag ger blta zhing /
translated: With the divine eye, free from such defects as blindness, I will always behold in actuality the Victorious Ones, the Transcendent Conquerors of the ten directions, the protectors surrounded by assemblies of bodhisattvas, the sole friends of transmigrating beings.

original: lta ba 'ba' zhig gis mi chog gi /
analyzed: lta ba 'ba' zhig gis mi chog gi /
translated: But mere beholding is not enough.

original: de dag re re la yang rgyun du skad cig gcig la mchod pa rgya chen po rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de dag re re la yang rgyun du skad cig gcig la mchod pa rgya chen po rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa /
translated: I will make offerings to each of them continuously, in every instant, with vast offerings endowed with the most sublime features,

original: nam mkha'i gtos dang mnyam pa /
analyzed: nam mkha'i gtos dang mnyam pa /
translated: equal to space,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis khyab pas mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis khyab pas mchod par bya'o //
translated: pervading the expanse of reality.

original: zhes pas mchod pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes pas mchod pa bstan to //
translated: This verse teaches the offerings.

original: dus ji srid du mchod ce na /üîΩma 'ongs bskal ba kun du ste /
analyzed: dus ji srid du mchod ce na / ma 'ongs bskal ba kun du ste /
translated: For how long will you make offerings?üîΩFor all future eons.

original: ma 'ongs bskal pa phyi mi'i mthar thug par ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs bskal pa phyi mi'i mthar thug par ro //
translated: Until the end of the future, until the end of time.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What will you do?

original: mi skyo bar te /
analyzed: mi skyo bar te /
translated: You will not be discouraged.

original: de srid du skyo ba med pa'i yid kyis mchod pa bla na med pa dag gis mchod cing blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba yin no /
analyzed: de srid du skyo ba med pa'i yid kyis mchod pa bla na med pa dag gis mchod cing blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba yin no /
translated: Until then, one should worship and look at the buddhas with an undaunted mind, making unsurpassable offerings.

original: // / da ni dgu pa dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba ni 'dzin pa dang / ston pa dang / sbyor ba dag gis te /
analyzed: // / da ni dgu pa dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba ni 'dzin pa dang / ston pa dang / sbyor ba dag gis te /
translated: Now, the ninth, upholding the sublime Dharma, is by means of upholding, teaching and practicing.

original: de gzung ba ni /
analyzed: de gzung ba ni /
translated: Upholding it is as follows.

original: rgyal ba dag gi dam pa'i chos 'dzin zhing //üîΩzhes pa la /
analyzed: rgyal ba dag gi dam pa'i chos 'dzin zhing // zhes pa la /
translated: Upholding the sublime Dharma of the victors,

original: dus gsum gyi rgyal ba rnams kyis bshad pa'i chos gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis po gang yin pa de dag thams cad bdag nyid mi brjed pa'i gzungs kyi stobs kyis tshig 'dzin zhing yang dag par don 'dzin pa dang / ston pa ni /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi rgyal ba rnams kyis bshad pa'i chos gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis po gang yin pa de dag thams cad bdag nyid mi brjed pa'i gzungs kyi stobs kyis tshig 'dzin zhing yang dag par don 'dzin pa dang / ston pa ni /
translated: The Dharma that is taught by the victors of the three times is the twelve branches of the scriptures. All of them are upheld by the power of one's own unforgetting memory, retaining the words and correctly retaining the meaning.üîΩTeaching is as follows.

original: byang chub sems dpa' kun du snang bar byed /üîΩces pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kun du snang bar byed / ces pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas illuminate all.

original: byang chub kyi spyod pa chos bshad pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang 'gro ba la kun du snang bar byed de /üîΩyongs su snang bar byed /
analyzed: byang chub kyi spyod pa chos bshad pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang 'gro ba la kun du snang bar byed de / yongs su snang bar byed /
translated: The essence of the bodhisattva conduct of teaching the Dharma is to illuminate all beings.üîΩIt is to fully illuminate.

original: ston par byed /
analyzed: ston par byed /
translated: It is to teach.

original: yang dag par rab tu ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu ston par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the one who teaches it perfectly.

original: 'di ltar byang chub spyod pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar rab tu ston par byad pa'i tshig rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub spyod pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar rab tu ston par byad pa'i tshig rnams la bya'o //
translated: Thus, the one who teaches in this way is called ‚Äúthe one who practices the career of the bodhisattva.‚Äù

original: sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni /
translated: The application is

original: bzang po spyod pa rnam par sbyang ba yang /üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: bzang po spyod pa rnam par sbyang ba yang / zhes pa ste /
translated: The purification of the career of the good.

original: @196b bzang po spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: @196b bzang po spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: The career of the good is the career of the bodhisattva.

original: de la rnam par sbyong ba ni skyon ma lus pa thag bsrings pas dri ma dang bral bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par sbyong ba ni skyon ma lus pa thag bsrings pas dri ma dang bral bar byed pa'o //
translated: The purification of that is the removal of all faults, by means of the distancing of their seeds.

original: de yang ji srid du bzhugs she na /
analyzed: de yang ji srid du bzhugs she na /
translated: And how long does that last?

original: ma 'ongs bskal ba kun du spyod par bgyi //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs bskal ba kun du spyod par bgyi // zhes pa ste /
translated: I will practice for all the ages to come.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa thams cad kyi mtha'i bar du spyad par bya 'bad par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa thams cad kyi mtha'i bar du spyad par bya 'bad par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no /
translated: I will practice, I will strive, for as long as it takes, until the end of all the ages to come.

original: // / de ni bcu pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la sogs pa yang dag par bsgrubs pas mi zad pa'i mdzod 'thob par bya ba'i phyir smon lam bsam pa ni /
analyzed: // / de ni bcu pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la sogs pa yang dag par bsgrubs pas mi zad pa'i mdzod 'thob par bya ba'i phyir smon lam bsam pa ni /
translated: The tenth is the aspiration to attain the inexhaustible treasure by means of the perfect accomplishment of the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: srid pa thams cad du yang 'khor ba na /
analyzed: srid pa thams cad du yang 'khor ba na /
translated: In all existences, in the course of cyclic existence,

original: bsod nams ye shes dag ni mi zad brnyes //üîΩzhes pa la /
analyzed: bsod nams ye shes dag ni mi zad brnyes // zhes pa la /
translated: one obtains inexhaustible merit and wisdom.

original: srid pa ni 'byung ba ste khams gsum thams cad du smon lam gyi dbang dang / las kyi dbang gis skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa nyams su myong ba ni 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa ni 'byung ba ste khams gsum thams cad du smon lam gyi dbang dang / las kyi dbang gis skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa nyams su myong ba ni 'khor ba'o //
translated: Existence is origination, and the experience of one birth after another through the power of aspiration and the power of karma in all the three realms is cyclic existence.

original: de la bsod nams ni sdig pa sel ba dang / dge ba byed pa dang / gtsang mar byed pa ste /üîΩpha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i phyogs sam /
analyzed: de la bsod nams ni sdig pa sel ba dang / dge ba byed pa dang / gtsang mar byed pa ste / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i phyogs sam /
translated: Merit is the elimination of evil, the performance of virtue, and the purification of the mind.üîΩIt is the side of virtue, such as the transcendences,

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs su gtogs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs su gtogs pa thams cad do //
translated: or it is the entire category of the accumulation of merit.

original: ye shes ni bdag med par rtog pa ste spros pa'i rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba /
analyzed: ye shes ni bdag med par rtog pa ste spros pa'i rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba /
translated: Wisdom is the realization of selflessness, free from all conceptual elaborations.

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: It is nonconceptual.

original: sangs rgyas thob pa'i rgyu bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs de lta bu nam yang zad par mi 'gyur ba de lta bu thob nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thob pa'i rgyu bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs de lta bu nam yang zad par mi 'gyur ba de lta bu thob nas /
translated: Having obtained such inexhaustible accumulations of merit and wisdom, which are the causes for attaining buddhahood,

original: shes rab la sogs pa'i yon tan thams cad kyi mdzod mi zad pa thob par shog shig ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: shes rab la sogs pa'i yon tan thams cad kyi mdzod mi zad pa thob par shog shig ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: may they obtain the inexhaustible treasure of all good qualities, such as wisdom.

original: thabs dang shes rab ting 'dzin rnam thar dang // zhes pa la /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab ting 'dzin rnam thar dang // zhes pa la /
translated: Skillful means, wisdom, samadhi, liberation,

original: thabs ni shes rab kyi bye brag nyid de /
analyzed: thabs ni shes rab kyi bye brag nyid de /
translated: Skillful means is a particular kind of wisdom.

original: rgyu chung ngu las 'bras bu chen por byed pa dang / tshegs chung ngu las grub pa'i don chen por byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu chung ngu las 'bras bu chen por byed pa dang / tshegs chung ngu las grub pa'i don chen por byed pa'o //
translated: It is that which makes a great result arise from a small cause and makes a great purpose accomplished with little difficulty.

original: de rgyu chung ngu las 'bras bu chen por grub pa ste /
analyzed: de rgyu chung ngu las 'bras bu chen por grub pa ste /
translated: That is the accomplishment of a great result from a small cause.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa na spyod pa na dge ba'i rtsa ba chung dus bla na med pa'i byang chub chen por bsngos pas zad mi shes par byed pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa na spyod pa na dge ba'i rtsa ba chung dus bla na med pa'i byang chub chen por bsngos pas zad mi shes par byed pas /
translated: When one is practicing the bodhisattva deeds, by dedicating the roots of virtue to the great unsurpassed enlightenment, they become inexhaustible.

original: gzhan gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang byang chub chen por bsngos par 'jug pas zad mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang byang chub chen por bsngos par 'jug pas zad mi shes pa ste /
translated: And the roots of virtue of others are dedicated to great enlightenment, so they are inexhaustible.

original: byang chub chen po thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub chen po thob par byed pa'o //
translated: They cause the attainment of great enlightenment.

original: de la tshegs chung dus grub pa ni /üîΩbdag dang @197a * //
analyzed: de la tshegs chung dus grub pa ni / bdag dang @197a * //
translated: Among them, accomplishment with little hardship

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub pa dag sla bas sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub pa dag sla bas sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: is the accomplishment of the aims of self and other through ease.

original: de shes rab ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid de de la rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de shes rab ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid de de la rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtogs par byed pa'o //
translated: Wisdom has the nature of fully discriminating phenomena, and it is the realization of their individual and general characteristics.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni sems mnyam par 'jog cing rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni sems mnyam par 'jog cing rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Concentration has the nature of mental equipoise and one-pointedness,

original: nam mkha' mdzod dang dri ma med pa'i phyag rgya la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' mdzod dang dri ma med pa'i phyag rgya la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as the sky treasury, the immaculate seal, and so on.

original: rnam par thar pa ni nyon mongs pa las 'grol ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa ni nyon mongs pa las 'grol ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Liberation has the nature of freedom from afflictions.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa'i snying rje la brten pa dang / sgyu ma lta bur gyur pa la zhes pa la sogs pa'o /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa'i snying rje la brten pa dang / sgyu ma lta bur gyur pa la zhes pa la sogs pa'o /
translated: The bodhisattva liberation is based on compassion, and it is said to be like an illusion.

original: // / bcu gcig pa 'jug pa la brgyad de /
analyzed: // / bcu gcig pa 'jug pa la brgyad de /
translated: The eleven topics of engagement are as follows:

original: sangs rgyas dang de'i zhing blta ba la 'jug pa gnyis dang / sangs rgyas kyi gsung la 'jug pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la 'jug pa dang / bskal pa la 'jug pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la blta ba dang de'i spyod yul la 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang de'i zhing blta ba la 'jug pa gnyis dang / sangs rgyas kyi gsung la 'jug pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la 'jug pa dang / bskal pa la 'jug pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la blta ba dang de'i spyod yul la 'jug pa dang /
translated: There are two topics of engagement: seeing the buddhas and their fields, engaging in the speech of the buddhas, engaging in turning the wheel of Dharma, engaging in eons, engaging in seeing the tathagatas and their domain,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing mngon par 'grub pa la 'jug pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i drung du 'gro ba la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing mngon par 'grub pa la 'jug pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i drung du 'gro ba la 'jug pa'o //
translated: engaging in the accomplishment of buddha fields, and engaging in going into the presence of the tathagatas.

original: sangs rgyas dang de'i zhing blta ba la 'jug pa la gnyis ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang de'i zhing blta ba la 'jug pa la gnyis ni /
translated: There are two topics of engagement in seeing the buddhas and their fields:

original: rdul gcig steng na rdul snyed zhing rnams te //
analyzed: rdul gcig steng na rdul snyed zhing rnams te //
translated: On a single atom, buddha fields as numerous as the atoms,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis spyir bshad pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis spyir bshad pa bstan to //
translated: and so forth. These two verses are taught in general.

original: de la rdul phra rab gcig gi steng na yang phyogs bcu dus gsum du bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing mthong bar gyur ces smon pa'o //
analyzed: de la rdul phra rab gcig gi steng na yang phyogs bcu dus gsum du bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing mthong bar gyur ces smon pa'o //
translated: The prayer is May I see the buddha-fields of the buddhas dwelling in the ten directions and three times on a single atom.

original: zhing der bsam gyis mi khyab sangs rgyas rnams //
analyzed: zhing der bsam gyis mi khyab sangs rgyas rnams //
translated: In those fields, inconceivable buddhas

original: sangs rgyas sras kyi dbus na bzhugs pa dag / ces pa ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras kyi dbus na bzhugs pa dag / ces pa ni /
translated: Dwelling in the midst of the buddhas' sons.

original: zhing re re'i steng na sangs rgyas bsam gyis mi khyab pa byang chub sems dpa'i dbus na bzhugs pa dag mthong bar gyur pa ste de ltar mos pa'o //
analyzed: zhing re re'i steng na sangs rgyas bsam gyis mi khyab pa byang chub sems dpa'i dbus na bzhugs pa dag mthong bar gyur pa ste de ltar mos pa'o //
translated: The prayer is that one may see on each of those fields inconceivable buddhas dwelling in the midst of bodhisattvas.

original: dus gang gi tshe na mthong bar smon zhe na /
analyzed: dus gang gi tshe na mthong bar smon zhe na /
translated: In what period does one pray to see them?

original: byang chub spyad pa spyod cing blta bar bgyi //üîΩzhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub spyad pa spyod cing blta bar bgyi // zhes bya ste /
translated: While practicing the conduct of enlightenment.

original: gong du smos pa'i byang chub kyi spyad pa spyod pa na /
analyzed: gong du smos pa'i byang chub kyi spyad pa spyod pa na /
translated: While practicing the conduct of enlightenment as described above,

original: zhing de snyed sangs rgyas 'khor dang bcas pa de snyed mthong bar shog cig pa'o //
analyzed: zhing de snyed sangs rgyas 'khor dang bcas pa de snyed mthong bar shog cig pa'o //
translated: may I see that many fields and that many buddhas together with their retinues.

original: skabs 'dir kha cig 'di skad rgol te /
analyzed: skabs 'dir kha cig 'di skad rgol te /
translated: At this point, some object as follows.

original: rdul gcig gi steng na sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig gi rnam par dbye ba de dag kyang mthong bar mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: rdul gcig gi steng na sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig gi rnam par dbye ba de dag kyang mthong bar mi 'gyur na /
translated: If they cannot see the layout of a single buddha realm on a single atom,

original: sangs @197b rgyas kyi zhing phyogs bcu dag tu gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rdul snyed rnams dang zhing re re la yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i dbus na bzhugs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag ma 'dres par so so na bzhugs pa
analyzed: sangs @197b rgyas kyi zhing phyogs bcu dag tu gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rdul snyed rnams dang zhing re re la yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i dbus na bzhugs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag ma 'dres par so so na bzhugs pa
translated: how could they possibly see the atoms of buddha realms in the ten directions, and in each of those realms the inconceivable number of bhagavat buddhas seated in the midst of bodhisattvas,

original: mthong bar ga la rung ste /
analyzed: mthong bar ga la rung ste /
translated: each one distinct?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni don med par smon pa ma yin na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni don med par smon pa ma yin na /
translated: Bodhisattvas do not make aspirations for no reason.

original: mi srid pa 'di lta bur smon kyang mi phan zer na /
analyzed: mi srid pa 'di lta bur smon kyang mi phan zer na /
translated: It is of no use to aspire to something that is impossible.‚Äù

original: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: This is not the case.

original: dper na las kyi sprul pa 'jig rten gyi khams snrel gzhi dang spyi'u tshugs la sogs pa tha dad pa yod pa bzhin du ye shes kyi sprul pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'di yod du mi rung ba ci yod de /
analyzed: dper na las kyi sprul pa 'jig rten gyi khams snrel gzhi dang spyi'u tshugs la sogs pa tha dad pa yod pa bzhin du ye shes kyi sprul pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'di yod du mi rung ba ci yod de /
translated: Just as there are different worldly realms, such as the upside-down and the right-side-up, which are emanations of karma, why is it impossible for there to be inconceivable emanations of wisdom?

original: de'i khungs kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de'i khungs kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan pa'i mdo las /
translated: The source of this is the Sutra Teaching the Inconceivable Qualities of the Buddha.

original: 'jig rten mgon po skyob pa yis //üîΩbsam gtan las dang klu rnams dang // sangs rgyas bdag nyid che rnams kyi //
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon po skyob pa yis // bsam gtan las dang klu rnams dang // sangs rgyas bdag nyid che rnams kyi //
translated: The protector of the world, the refuge

original: bsam gyis mi khyab bzhir bshad do //
